trans-unit.source: The BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator class is used internally by the <xref uid="langword_csharp_aspnet_regbrowsers" name="aspnet_regbrowsers" href=""></xref> tool to parse .browser browser definition files and add browsers to the run-time collection of known browsers contained in the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory"></xref> object.

This class generates the source code for an assembly for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory> class, which, at run time, produces request-specific <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase> objects to be publicly accessed through the ASP.NET intrinsic `Request.Browser` property.
Used internally to create a new instance of <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator"></xref>.
Used internally to coordinate the behavior of this class.
This method first iterates through the "Browsers" folder.

It then calls <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesCodeGenerator.ProcessBrowserFiles%2A>, which loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers.

Then it calls an internal method which generates the source code compiles it, and registers it as an assembly in the global assembly cache for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.BrowserCapabilitiesFactory> object.
If necessary, this method then calls an internal method that restarts the Web server.
Loads and parses the XML contained in a collection of browser-definition files and inserts the information contained therein into an internal collection of browsers.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to use a virtual path; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The path to the virtual directory that contains the browser-definition files.
Removes the browser capabilities factory from the global assembly cache and deletes its strong name public key token file.
This method restarts the Web service.
The browser capabilities factory is then removed from the global assembly cache, and its strong name public key token file is deleted.
The Web service is then restarted again if the uninstall succeeds.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the browser capabilities factory was uninstalled from the global assembly cache; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
